body:
Hi! I´m trying to model a horizontal shading slate that is offset above the start of the window and/or extends beyond the side edges of the window. I seems that E+ only allows me to stay within the window boundaries. Im just about to give up on using the E+ [WindowMaterial:Shade](http://bigladdersoftware.com/epx/docs/8-3/input-output-reference/group-surface-construction-elements.html#windowmaterialshade) components for this task but then I got some confusing hope by the E+ manual when I saw the "OtherShadingType", and some other ways that I might be able to input what I wanted.

Does anyone have any insight into the limitations and workarounds of E+ on this?  Note: I´d prefer not to use a context geometry because I want the thermal properties like radiation balance and so on to be calculated.
